alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 2:55AM CST until February 18 at 10:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected with the potential for brief visibility reductions below a quarter of a mile in any falling snow. Total snow accumulations of less than one inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Dodge, Olmsted, Mower and Fillmore Counties. * WHEN...The band of snow moves through between noon and 4pm with strong winds, blowing snow, and rapidly falling temperatures late this afternoon into tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures quickly fall late this afternoon and evening. This may lead to a flash freeze of any roads that are wet from melting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
